channel.title: Crash after first tram loading screen
channel.description:
Hey guys I have been trying to play Black Mesa. Unfortunately whenever I play, once I reach the first loading screen on the starting tram my game goes to a clipped static screen of the outside. I looked in console and it was spamming a rendering error. So I tried to lower all my settings to get through the tram but instead of getting the static screen I would just get a black screen with a different rendering error. I downloaded from two different mirrors and re-installed multiple times with no results; at this point I am not sure what I should do.
![](upload://b8RHgxbDXzMS0Qw84Ytnb4X0zIh.jpeg)
COMP SPECS: CPU: amd fx-4100 quad core ~3.6ghz GPU: GeForce gtx 550 ti RAM: 8 gigs of hyperX MB: Asus M5A78L-M LX ![2012-09-16_00001.jpg|690x500](upload://cKeqQciqbjL8dEM2fSW38XbM2YU.jpeg)

item.title: Crash after first tram loading screen
item.dc:creator: willwill5
item.description:
hajducek:

Try skipping tram with commands like “map bm_c1a1b/bm_c1a1c/bm_c1a1c/” and go on.

I put that code into console and it gives me an error saying that that map doesn’t exist. :fffuuu:

Read full topic
item.source: Crash after first tram loading screen

item.title: Crash after first tram loading screen
item.dc:creator: willwill5
item.description:
vktech:

Try adding “-dxlevel 90” to launch options. Not sure if it’ll work, but it’s worth a shot (it fixed some bugs for me).

Thanks for the suggestion but I am still getting the static screen :[

Read full topic

item.title: Crash after first tram loading screen
item.dc:creator: vktech
item.description:
willwill5:

Hey guys I have been trying to play Black Mesa. Unfortunately whenever I play, once I reach the first loading screen on the starting tram my game goes to a clipped static screen of the outside. I looked in console and it was spamming a rendering error. So I tried to lower all my settings to get through the tram but instead of getting the static screen I would just get a black screen with a different rendering error. I downloaded from two different mirrors and re-installed multiple times with no results; at this point I am not sure what I should do.

COMP SPECS:
CPU: amd fx-4100 quad core ~3.6ghz
GPU: GeForce gtx 550 ti
RAM: 8 gigs of hyperX
MB: Asus M5A78L-M LX

Try adding “-dxlevel 90” to launch options. Not sure if it’ll work, but it’s worth a shot (it fixed some bugs for me).

Read full topic
